scenarioDescription:
The TIC 257060897 Exoplanetary System


Overview

TIC 257060897 is a star with 1.32 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.82 times its radius. It is located 1649.38 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.47 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

TIC 257060897 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the TIC 257060897 system


TIC 257060897 b

TIC 257060897 b was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) observatory, in 2021-10, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of TIC 257060897 b is 213.060 times the mass of Earth. The radius of TIC 257060897 b is 16.701 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, TIC 257060897 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system TIC 257060897, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS).
name: TIC 257060897 - System With 1 Exoplanet
